description: Starts up full screen and autoplays random videos related to whatever title happens to be at the top of the list. The settings menu offers no ability to disable autoplay. Really there's very little functionality exposed and what's there is off putting. I can't comment on how well it manages the task of browsing and launching games because the affront of the unexpected and unwanted video left me hunting in a panic for a way to make it stop. Thank goodness escape brings up a menu, because I didn't see a button anywhere. I hate this software.

Text based configuration files can be a bit of a pain to deal with at first, but once you get used to it, there's no better option for Linux if you want a controller based UI.

I use Launchbox on my Windows PC with the Pegasus Metadata Export plugin, and that handles everything completely fine, with the superior metadata from the Launchbox GamesDB.
summary: Takes some effort, but definitely the best frontend available
